1641.24.text: We have to rise to the moment.

1644.58.text:
Then we, like those before us,
can lay that new foundation for

1649.08.text:
another 70 years of security
and prosperity and peace.

1653.89.text:
Again if you forgive me, to
quote another Irish poet

1657.06.text:
Seamus Heaney, he said:
History teaches us not

1659.12.text:
to hope on this side of
the grave, but then once

1661.33.text:
in a lifetime that
tidal wave of justice

1665.10.text:
rises up, and hope
and history rhyme.

1677.64.text:
I got elected when I
was a 29-year-old kid.

1681.35.text:
I'm more optimistic
about the prospects,

1683.52.text:
if we have the courage, of
setting the 21st century in a

1688.42.text:
direction that will avoid the
carnage of the 20th century,

1695.66.text:
So let's take a shot at making
hope and history rhyme.
